title: 110_hr1157
content: The "Breast Cancer and Environmental Research Act of 2008" establishes the Interagency Breast Cancer and Environmental Research Coordinating Committee to share and coordinate information on existing research. The Interagency Breast Cancer and Environmental Research Coordinating Committee aims to improve existing research programs related to breast cancer by sharing information, developing a comprehensive research strategy, and advising on collaborative research proposals to study environmental and genomic factors. The Interagency Breast Cancer and Environmental Research Coordinating Committee aims to enhance breast cancer research by promoting collaboration between national research institutes, expanding research proposals, and developing a summary of research advances. Recommendations will be made to the Secretary regarding any necessary changes to research efforts. The Secretary will receive recommendations on improving research activities, avoiding duplication of efforts, increasing public participation, and disseminating information on breast cancer. The Committee will focus on disseminating information on breast cancer research progress and expanding partnerships between public and private entities for collaborative research. Membership will include up to 7 voting Federal representatives. The Committee will include the Director of the CDC, the Director of the NIH, representatives from the National Cancer Institute, heads of other relevant HHS agencies, and representatives from other federal agencies involved in cancer research. The Committee will include representatives from federal agencies involved in cancer research, including the Department of Defense. The Committee will have 12 additional voting members appointed by the Secretary, including 6 members from various scientific and health backgrounds representing different regions of the United States. The Committee will have 6 members appointed from the general public representing individuals with breast cancer. Nonvoting members may be included as determined by the Secretary. The voting members will select a chairperson, subject to approval by the Director of NIH. Meetings will be held at least once a year. The Secretary will review the necessity of the Committee every two years. Authorization of Appropriations: $40,000,000 for each fiscal year 2009-2012 for research activities under title IV of the Public Health Service Act.
